instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.CHARGER_AGATE_DIV: What is CHARGER_AGATE_DIV? This is a typo of CHGR_AGATE_DIV. When you see CHARGER_AGATE_DIV, assume they meant to type CHGR_AGATE_DIV.
definitions.CHARGER_AGATE: What is CHARGER_AGATE? This is a typo of CHGR_AGATE. When you see CHARGER_AGATE, assume they meant to type CHGR_AGATE.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.820-3332S: What is 820-3332S? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
Here are Some Measurements 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 0.975V with Board plugged in
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Diode Mode -0.927V
<SIGNAL>PPP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>  3.4V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>. 0.942V
<RESISTOR>R7029</RESISTOR> (Pin 1) 3.39v  (Pin 2)  3.4v
<CAPACITOR>C7505</CAPACITOR> Pin 1.  0.942V


iSL 6259 
4.8 Ohms Between pins 17&18
23.2 Ohms Between Pins 27&28

Any Help is GREATLY APPRECIATED

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
"Pin 3 = 0.00V"
Missing ACIN for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

"Pin 1 = 15.86V
Pin 14 = 0.00V"
These are just the result of above mentioned; as missing <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> too.

"Getting 0.925 mOhms on Both sides of <RESISTOR>R7029</RESISTOR>"
If is diode medo to ground, you probably forgot to disconnect power...

Check <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/11 and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR>.
If all OK, change <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

"trying to get the Values for <RESISTOR>R7110</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R7111</RESISTOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7111</CAPACITOR>"
Not needed now.
If you get <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>, then ACIN is good too.

Schematic not available, try using 00163.

Post real diode mode on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, without charger, nor battery; red probe at ground.

And post again voltage for the same pins of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 4.40mOhm in Diode Mode With Red On Ground"
Impossible to get such reading on diode mode.
Please, set your DMM correctly; diode mode, not ohm mode!
Use manual one, you cannot get confused then.

"Pin 18. 1.830v
<RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR>
Pin 1 = 15.86V (<SIGNAL>CHARGER_AGATE_DIV</SIGNAL>)
Pin2 = 0.006V (<SIGNAL>CHARGER_AGATE</SIGNAL>)"
Change <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
No boardview needed!
As per schematic, <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> is the only dual MOSFET (metal case) connected with F7005; and obviously with J7000.
Just follow the trace from power connector (with buzzer)...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
Your board could have two separated MOSFETs for this job.
Check if one beeps with power connector (<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>) and the other one beeps with <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> (pins 27/28).
The nearest big black resistor is probably <RESISTOR>R7120</RESISTOR>...

threads.message: I also checked <CAPACITOR>C7185</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R7186</RESISTOR> (<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>) with DMM in Manual OHms mode  and I Get OL on pins 1 of both with No Beeps?...Does that Help?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
Can you post voltage on the both black MOSFETs?
Specify voltage for pins.
Looking at schematic, <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR> is "built" in your case with these two MOSFETs.
Cannot be such difficult to imagine what you need to do.
Probably one of them is bad; change both if you don't know  how to test.
I hope you can solder proper ones instead...

threads.message: Why don't you try AON7403, or other P-channel MOSFET in the same case?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has Green Light that turns Orange But no Fan Spin Not turning on.
threads.message:
If you don't see any on your scrap boards, then buy AON7403, FDMC6675, or other P-channel MOSFET with similar V/I parameters.
Why don't you remove them and check if are good?
Google can help you in any case...
